title.narrative: Creating Environmental Culture to Empower the Youth in Tanzania (CECE)

description.narrative: There are 250 AIDS orphan youths in the project region villages. Due to the lack of social security they have been placed into their relative families where there already are many children and lack of food. The AIDS orphans live in an environmental disaste r area. The livelihood of the family is based on the grazing of the cattle. Overgrazing erosion caused by rainstorms and draught caused by the irregularity of the rainy seasons reduce the pastures. The project will empower the AIDS orphans with more attitu de skills and tools to improve their living environment and it strengthens their self-esteem as important members of the community. This also enables the sufficient feed of the grazing cattle with fodder. The project also offers the AIDS orphan youths food assistance. With the help of the project new environmentally-centered afternoon club activities will be launched. The new base will be the club house called Jericho in the Ekenywa village owned by WEPA (Women Educational Project of Arumeru) situated alon g the highway approximately 14 km from Arusha to the direction of Nairobi. The AIDS orphan youths from Ekenywa Lengijave ja Elikureti villages will gather for four hours twice a month after school to the club house to receive food and environmental educat ion. In addition the project will organize the youth practical exercises on environmental protection in smaller groups. The emphasis of the education is to prevent erosion and to restore forests on the high plateau savanna.
